Package org.dkr.graph.algo.community

Class StronglyConnectedComponents<VV,​EV>

java.lang.Object
org.dkr.graph.algo.community.StronglyConnectedComponents<VV,​EV>
Type Parameters:
VV - vertex value type
EV - edge value type
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.apache.flink.graph.GraphAlgorithm<Long,​VV,​EV,​org.apache.flink.api.java.DataSet<org.apache.flink.graph.Vertex<Long,​SCCVertexDataType>>>
public class StronglyConnectedComponents<VV,​EV> extends Object implements org.apache.flink.graph.GraphAlgorithm<Long,​VV,​EV,​org.apache.flink.api.java.DataSet<org.apache.flink.graph.Vertex<Long,​SCCVertexDataType>>>
The StronglyConnectedComponents computes the strongly connected component for the input graph.

This code implements the algorithm in Da Yan, James Cheng, Kai Xing, Yi Lu, Wilfred Ng, Yingyi Bu: Pregel Algorithms for Graph Connectivity Problems with Performance Guarantees. Proc. VLDB Endow. 7(14): 1821-1832 (2014).

We recommend that the input graph should be a simple, directed graph containing no duplicate edges or self-loops. TODO: 1. Can we remove the maxIterationsEachPhase parameter and let the algo itself judge whether the algo comes to the end? TODO: 2. Survey the Flink memory management mechanism.
